White's pawn chain has effectively sealed off black's wB.
moves.8... f6 9. exf6 Qxf6 10. Nf1 Bd6 11. Ng3: unnecessary. better is 11....h6, preventing Bg5 once black castles Q-side.
white switches gears from protecting the unoccupied e5 square to attacking black's P at e6.
moves.16... Nd8: forced. black cannot play 16....e5 since 17.PxP N/BxP 18.f4, and thus winning a pinned piece.
moves.17. Qg4: not only puts pressure on the e6 P, but white's Q is aligned with the enemy K.
moves.19. Nxe6 Nxe6 20. Rxe6: white threatens a discovered check with his next move.
moves.20... Qf7: black miscalculates white's double check for mate with 21.Re8++. better is 20....Qd7 21.RxN QxQ 22.PxQ Re8, leaving black, albeit down, with a fighting chance.
